author: potuz
content:
I have a loose question about 2 slot PBS. It boils to what do we lose if the proposer does not have yet attestations for the previous execution payload. I mean suppose that the proposer
1_ knows the previous blinded block was heavily attested
2_ saw the execution payload and it's VALID.
If we work under the assumption that the majority of validators are honest (which we do) then the risk is that the builder sent him the block and not the rest of the network. But why is this such a bad thing? What is there for the builder to forfeit his block this way and do network manipulation just to grief the next proposer? With that assumption attesters could just attest for the previous payload and the current beacon block

author: potuz
content: One issue I can see is that if the builder does the opposite of sending the block late to the proposer and early to the rest of the network then it may succeed in forking the next consensus block. But it still requires network splitting
